questions.question: 観光地で（＿）を借りれば、自由に移動できます。
questions.hint:
観光地かんこうち (kankouchi) - tourist spot
移動いどう (idou) - movement

explanation.correct:
Correct!
『レンタカー』 (rentakaa) means 'rental car,' which is the most logical item to help you move around freely in a tourist area.

  • 1. レンタカー – rental car (レンタカー, rentakaa)
  • 2. 傘 – umbrella (かさ, kasa)
  • 3. 携帯電話 – mobile phone (けいたいでんわ, keitaidenwa)
  • 4. ノート – notebook (ノート, nooto)

English Sentence: If you rent a car in a tourist area, you can move around freely.
explanation.incorrect:
Answer: レンタカー (rentakaa) - rental car
Other options don't help with 'movement' or 'travel'.

questions.question: ホテルの部屋から（＿）が見えるので、朝日がきれいです。
questions.hint:
海うみ (umi) - ocean
朝日あさひ (asahi) - morning sun

explanation.correct:
Correct!
『海』 (うみ, umi) means 'ocean', which provides a beautiful view for watching the sunrise.

  • 1. 空港 – airport (くうこう, kuukou)
  • 2. 海 – ocean (うみ, umi)
  • 3. 駅 – station (えき, eki)
  • 4. スーパー – supermarket (suupaa)

English Sentence: The ocean can be seen from the hotel room, so the sunrise is beautiful.
explanation.incorrect:
Answer: 海 (うみ, umi) - ocean
Only 'ocean' fits the context of a scenic view with sunrise.

questions.question: 両替所で日本円を（＿）に替えました。
questions.hint:
現地通貨げんちつうか (genchi tsuuka) - local currency
両替所りょうがえじょ (ryougaejo) - currency exchange

explanation.correct:
Correct!
『現地通貨』 (げんちつうか, genchi tsuuka) means 'local currency,' which is the usual purpose at a currency exchange.

  • 1. 現地通貨 – local currency (げんちつうか, genchi tsuuka)
  • 2. 切手 – postage stamp (きって, kitte)
  • 3. 商品券 – gift certificate (しょうひんけん, shouhinken)
  • 4. 電子マネー – e-money (でんしまねー, denshi manee)

English Sentence: I exchanged Japanese yen for local currency at the currency exchange.
explanation.incorrect:
Answer: 現地通貨 (げんちつうか, genchi tsuuka) - local currency
This is the standard item exchanged at a foreign exchange booth.

questions.question: 先生：レポートは来週の月曜日（＿）出してください。
questions.hint:
提出ていしゅつ (teishutsu) - submission
月曜日げつようび (getsuyoubi) - Monday

explanation.correct:
Correct!
『までに』 (made ni) means 'by (a certain time),' indicating a deadline.

  • 1. まで – until (まで, made)
  • 2. までに – by (a deadline) (までに, made ni)
  • 3. から – from (から, kara)
  • 4. しか – only (しか, shika – requires negative)

English Sentence: Teacher: Please submit your report by next Monday.
explanation.incorrect:
Answer: までに (までに, made ni) - by a deadline
This is the only option that correctly indicates when something must be submitted.

questions.question: 先輩：アルバイトと勉強を（＿）のは大変でしょう？
questions.hint:
両立りょうりつ (ryouritsu) - to balance both
大変たいへん (taihen) - tough

explanation.correct:
Correct!
『両立する』 (りょうりつする, ryouritsu suru) means 'to balance or manage both.' It fits the context of juggling work and study.

  • 1. 両立する – to balance (りょうりつする, ryouritsu suru)
  • 2. 反対する – to oppose (はんたいする, hantai suru)
  • 3. 混乱する – to be confused (こんらんする, konran suru)
  • 4. 中止する – to cancel (ちゅうしする, chuushi suru)

English Sentence: Senior: Isn’t it tough to balance part-time work and studying?
explanation.incorrect:
Answer: 両立する (りょうりつする, ryouritsu suru) - to balance
This is the only option expressing the idea of managing two tasks together.
